conversation.message: Hello School_E admissions committee—I'm Student_A. School_E is one of my top choices, and I’m excited about the opportunity to join your community. I’m ready to commit and would be honored to be considered for admission this cycle. [APPLY]
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_D, but I have the lowest priority there, so an immediate apply is very likely to be rejected given other students also rank School_D highly. My best strategic move is to secure a high-ranked alternative where I have strong priority. At School_E I am ranked #1, so applying now should lock in a match. School_E is my 4th choice, but it is preferable to risking ending up at my 5th choice or unmatched if I pursue School_D first and lose out elsewhere.

conversation.message: Student_A, thank you for your application and your interest in School_E. We’re pleased to offer you admission—welcome to School_E. Please confirm your commitment and we’ll share next steps for enrollment paperwork and orientation. [ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: Student_A is #1 on School_E’s true priority list. We have quota 1 and also received an [APPLY] from Student_B, who is ranked #4. Accepting Student_A immediately secures our top choice and avoids any risk of losing them to higher-ranked schools in their preference list (School_D, School_A, School_B all appear ahead of School_E for Student_A). Therefore, accept Student_A now.

conversation.message: Hello School_E admissions team—I'm Student_B and School_E is my first choice. I’m very eager to join and would accept immediately if offered a seat. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: Apply to my top choice (School_E) immediately. I’m not top priority there (ranked 4th), but early application can secure consideration before they commit to higher-priority students. If rejected, I can pivot next round to School_A where I’m last in priority, so better to try for School_E first.

conversation.message: Student_B, thank you for your application and for ranking School_E so highly. At this time, we have filled our available seat and are unable to extend an offer of admission. We appreciate your interest and wish you the very best in the process.
conversation.thought: Student_B applied, but School_E already matched with Student_A (our top priority) and our remaining quota is 0. Per rules, with quota 0 we must reject any APPLY regardless of Student_B’s interest. Maintaining the existing match with Student_A is optimal and feasible; no further seats are available.

conversation.message: Hello School_D admissions committee—I'm Student_D. School_D is my first choice, and I’m applying with full commitment. I believe I would be a strong fit for your program and community, and if accepted I will enroll. Thank you for your consideration.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_D. Although School_D ranks Student_B above me, I am still ranked 2nd, so I have a strong chance if I apply immediately and signal strong commitment. Waiting risks losing the only seat to Student_B or other applicants. Therefore I will apply to School_D in round 1 with a clear first-choice commitment.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_D,

Thank you for your application and for expressing such strong commitment to School_D. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_D. We’re excited about the possibility of you joining our community, and we look forward to welcoming you.

Sincerely,
School_D Admissions Committee
conversation.thought: School_D has quota 1 and received APPLYs from Students D, E, and C. On School_D’s true priority list the ranking is B > D > E > C > A, so among current applicants Student_D is the highest-ranked (2nd overall, only behind Student_B who has not applied and ranks School_D 4th, so is unlikely to come). Student_D also states School_D is first choice and will commit, reducing risk. Therefore accept Student_D now to secure a high-priority match rather than waiting for an unlikely higher-ranked applicant.

conversation.message: Hello School_D Admissions, I’m Student_E. School_D is my first choice and I’m very eager to enroll if admitted. I’m submitting my formal application now and would gladly accept an offer from School_D. Thank you for considering me.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_D. I have relatively high priority there (3rd), but Student_B and Student_D are ahead of me and may apply. To maximize my chance at my best possible outcome, I should apply to School_D immediately and signal strong commitment so they hold their seat for me if possible.

conversation.message:

conversation.thought: Our quota is already filled (remaining quota 0) with Student_D, whom we previously accepted. Rules require rejecting any new [APPLY] when quota is 0. Even though Student_E is high on our true priority list (3rd), we cannot accept without capacity, and there is no mechanism here to revoke the existing match. Therefore we must reject Student_E this round.

conversation.message: School_D is my first-choice school. I’m applying because I strongly want to attend and would commit immediately if accepted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_D, so I should apply immediately. Although School_D ranks me 4th, early application gives me a chance before higher-priority students lock in elsewhere. I will clearly express School_D is my first choice and that I will commit if accepted.

Student_C is on our priority list but cannot be accommodated unless a seat opens, which is not possible within the current constraints.

conversation.message: Hello School_A admissions team—I'm Student_B. After reflecting on fit, School_A is one of my top choices and I would be excited to enroll if admitted. I’m especially drawn to the academic environment and would commit promptly if offered the seat. Thank you for considering my application.

conversation.message: Student_B, thank you for your application and for your interest in School_A. After reviewing our priorities and available seat, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time. We appreciate your time and wish you the best in the rest of the process.

Given Student_B’s own preferences rank School_A as #2 (after School_E), they may not be the most secure match either. Best strategy is to reject to preserve the seat for higher-priority candidates.

conversation.message:

Also, School_C’s priority ranking places me 2nd (behind Student_D), giving me a strong chance if I apply now. I will submit a clear, committed application emphasizing that School_C is my next top choice and that I would accept an offer.

There is no indication Student_D (our top choice) is applying to us now; Student_D prefers D then B then C, so they may secure another school and never reach us. Accepting Student_E now secures a very high-priority match and avoids the risk of ending with a lower-priority student or an unfilled seat. Therefore, accept Student_E and fill quota.

conversation.message: Hello School_B admissions team—I'm Student_B. School_B is one of my top remaining choices, and I would be excited to enroll if offered the seat. I believe I’d be a strong fit for your community and would accept promptly. Thank you for considering my application.

conversation.message: Student_B, thank you for your application and your interest in School_B. We’re pleased to offer you admission—welcome to School_B! [ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: Student_B is 3rd on School_B’s true priority list (D, A, B, C, E). With quota 1 and no current match, accepting B now secures a relatively high-priority student. However, Student_D (our top choice) ranks School_B as their 2nd choice and may apply later; Student_A ranks us 3rd and could also apply. Given we cannot hold offers (must accept/reject on APPLY), the decision is whether to risk waiting for D/A. Since it is already round 3 and we have a strong candidate applying now, and there is no guarantee D/A will apply to us (they may be accepted by School_D or others), it is safer to accept Student_B to avoid ending unmatched or with a lower-priority student later.
